member.summary: The protocol version. Different versions doesn't talk to each other.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.NetworkTransport
member.summary: The transport hosts the sever uses

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.RegisteredScenes
member.summary: A list of SceneNames that can be used during networked games.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.AllowRuntimeSceneChanges
member.summary: Whether or not runtime scene changes should be allowed and expected. If this is true, clients with different initial configurations will not work together.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.NetworkedPrefabs
member.summary: A list of spawnable prefabs

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.PlayerPrefabHash
member.summary: The default player prefab

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.CreatePlayerPrefab
member.summary: Whether or not a player object should be created by default. This value can be overriden on a case by case basis with ConnectionApproval.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.ReceiveTickrate
member.summary: Amount of times per second the receive queue is emptied and all messages inside are processed.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.MaxReceiveEventsPerTickRate
member.summary: The max amount of messages to process per ReceiveTickrate. This is to prevent flooding.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.EventTickrate
member.summary: The amount of times per second internal frame events will occur, examples include SyncedVar send checking.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.MaxObjectUpdatesPerTick
member.summary: The maximum amount of NetworkedObject's to process per tick. This is useful to prevent the MLAPI from hanging a frame Set this to less than or equal to 0 for unlimited

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.ClientConnectionBufferTimeout
member.summary: The amount of seconds to wait for handshake to complete before timing out a client

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.ConnectionApproval
member.summary: Whether or not to use connection approval

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.ConnectionData
member.summary: The data to send during connection which can be used to decide on if a client should get accepted

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.SecondsHistory
member.summary: The amount of seconds to keep a lag compensation position history

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.EnableTimeResync
member.summary: If your logic uses the NetworkedTime, this should probably be turned off. If however it's needed to maximize accuracy, this is recommended to be turned on

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.TimeResyncInterval
member.summary: If time resync is turned on, this specifies the interval between syncs in seconds.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.EnableNetworkedVar
member.summary: Whether or not to enable the NetworkedVar system. This system runs in the Update loop and will degrade performance, but it can be a huge convenience. Only turn it off if you have no need for the NetworkedVar system.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.EnsureNetworkedVarLengthSafety
member.summary: Whether or not to ensure that NetworkedVars can be read even if a client accidentally writes where its not allowed to. This costs some CPU and bandwdith.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.EnableSceneManagement
member.summary: Enables scene management. This will allow network scene switches and automatic scene diff corrections upon connect. SoftSynced scene objects wont work with this disabled. That means that disabling SceneManagement also enables PrefabSync.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.ForceSamePrefabs
member.summary: Whether or not the MLAPI should check for differences in the prefabs at connection. If you dynamically add prefabs at runtime, turn this OFF

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.UsePrefabSync
member.summary: If true, all NetworkedObject's need to be prefabs and all scene objects will be replaced on server side which causes all serialization to be lost. Useful for multi project setups If false, Only non scene objects have to be prefabs. Scene objects will be matched using their PrefabInstanceId which can be precomputed globally for a scene at build time. Useful for single projects

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.RecycleNetworkIds
member.summary: If true, NetworkIds will be reused after the NetworkIdRecycleDelay.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.NetworkIdRecycleDelay
member.summary: The amount of seconds a NetworkId has to be unused in order for it to be reused.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.RpcHashSize
member.summary: Decides how many bytes to use for Rpc messaging. Leave this to 2 bytes unless you are facing hash collisions

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.LoadSceneTimeOut
member.summary: The amount of seconds to wait on all clients to load requested scene before the SwitchSceneProgress onComplete callback, that waits for all clients to complete loading, is called anyway.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.EnableMessageBuffering
member.summary: Whether or not message buffering should be enabled. This will resolve most out of order messages during spawn.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.MessageBufferTimeout
member.summary: The amount of time a message should be buffered for without being consumed. If it is not consumed within this time, it will be dropped.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.EnableNetworkLogs
member.summary: Whether or not to enable network logs.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.EnableEncryption
member.summary: Whether or not to enable the ECDHE key exchange to allow for encryption and authentication of messages

member.name: F:MLAPI.Configuration.NetworkConfig.SignKeyExchange
member.summary: Whether or not to enable signed diffie hellman key exchange.

member.name: T:MLAPI.Security.BigInteger
member.summary: This is a BigInteger class. Holds integer that is more than 64-bit (long).
member.remarks: This class contains overloaded arithmetic operators(+, -, *, /, %), bitwise operators(&, |) and other operations that can be done with normal integer. It also contains implementation of various prime test. This class also contains methods dealing with cryptography such as generating prime number, generating a coprime number.

member.name: M:MLAPI.Security.BigInteger.FermatLittleTest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Probabilistic prime test based on Fermat's little theorem
member.remarks:
for any a < p (p does not divide a) if a^(p-1) mod p != 1 then p is not prime.
Otherwise, p is probably prime (pseudoprime to the chosen base).
This method is fast but fails for Carmichael numbers when the randomly chosen base is a factor of the number.
member.param: Number of chosen bases
member.returns: True if this is a pseudoprime to randomly chosen bases

member.name: M:MLAPI.Security.BigInteger.RabinMillerTest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Probabilistic prime test based on Rabin-Miller's
member.remarks:
for any p > 0 with p - 1 = 2^s * t
p is probably prime (strong pseudoprime) if for any a < p, 1) a^t mod p = 1 or 2) a^((2^j)*t) mod p = p-1 for some 0 <= j <= s-1
Otherwise, p is composite.
member.param: Number of chosen bases
member.returns: True if this is a strong pseudoprime to randomly chosen bases

member.name: M:MLAPI.Security.BigInteger.SolovayStrassenTest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Probabilistic prime test based on Solovay-Strassen (Euler Criterion)
member.remarks:
p is probably prime if for any a < p (a is not multiple of p), a^((p-1)/2) mod p = J(a, p)
where J is the Jacobi symbol.
Otherwise, p is composite.
member.param: Number of chosen bases
member.returns: True if this is a Euler pseudoprime to randomly chosen bases

member.name: M:MLAPI.Security.BigInteger.LucasStrongTest
member.summary: Implementation of the Lucas Strong Pseudo Prime test
member.remarks:
Let n be an odd number with gcd(n,D) = 1, and n - J(D, n) = 2^s * d with d odd and s >= 0.
If Ud mod n = 0 or V2^r*d mod n = 0 for some 0 <= r < s, then n is a strong Lucas pseudoprime with parameters (P, Q). We select P and Q based on Selfridge.
member.returns: True if number is a strong Lucus pseudo prime

member.name: M:MLAPI.Security.BigInteger.IsProbablePrime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether a number is probably prime using the Rabin-Miller's test
member.remarks: Before applying the test, the number is tested for divisibility by primes < 2000
member.param: Number of chosen bases
member.returns: True if this is probably prime

member.name: M:MLAPI.Security.BigInteger.IsProbablePrime
member.summary: Determines whether this BigInteger is probably prime using a combination of base 2 strong pseudoprime test and Lucas strong pseudoprime test
member.remarks:
The sequence of the primality test is as follows,
1) Trial divisions are carried out using prime numbers below 2000. if any of the primes divides this BigInteger, then it is not prime.
2) Perform base 2 strong pseudoprime test. If this BigInteger is a base 2 strong pseudoprime, proceed on to the next step.
3) Perform strong Lucas pseudoprime test.
For a detailed discussion of this primality test, see [6].
member.returns: True if this is probably prime

member.summary: Returns a value that is equivalent to the integer square root of this
member.remarks: The integer square root of "this" is defined as the largest integer n, such that (n * n) <= this. Square root of negative integer is an undefined behaviour (UB).
member.returns: Integer square root of this

member.name: M:MLAPI.Security.BigInteger.LucasSequence(MLAPI.Security.BigInteger,MLAPI.Security.BigInteger,MLAPI.Security.BigInteger,MLAPI.Security.BigInteger)
member.summary: Returns the k_th number in the Lucas Sequence reduced modulo n
member.remarks:
Uses index doubling to speed up the process. For example, to calculate V(k), we maintain two numbers in the sequence V(n) and V(n+1).
To obtain V(2n), we use the identity V(2n) = (V(n) * V(n)) - (2 * Q^n) To obtain V(2n+1), we first write it as V(2n+1) = V((n+1) + n) and use the identity V(m+n) = V(m) * V(n) - Q * V(m-n) Hence, V((n+1) + n) = V(n+1) * V(n) - Q^n * V((n+1) - n) = V(n+1) * V(n) - Q^n * V(1) = V(n+1) * V(n) - Q^n * P
We use k in its binary expansion and perform index doubling for each bit position. For each bit position that is set, we perform an index doubling followed by an index addition. This means that for V(n), we need to update it to V(2n+1). For V(n+1), we need to update it to V((2n+1)+1) = V(2*(n+1))
This function returns [0] = U(k) [1] = V(k) [2] = Q^n
Where U(0) = 0 % n, U(1) = 1 % n V(0) = 2 % n, V(1) = P % n

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.Resizable
member.summary: Whether or not the stream will grow the buffer to accomodate more data.

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.GrowthFactor
member.summary: Factor by which buffer should grow when necessary.

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.CanRead
member.summary: Whether or not stream supports reading. (Always true)

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.HasDataToRead
member.summary: Whether or not or there is any data to be read from the stream.

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Whether or not seeking is supported by this stream. (Always true)

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Whether or not this stream can accept new data. NOTE: this will return true even if only fewer than 8 bits can be written!

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.Capacity
member.summary: Current buffer size. The buffer will not be resized (if possible) until Position is equal to Capacity and an attempt to write data is made.

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.Length
member.summary: The current length of data considered to be "written" to the buffer.

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.Position
member.summary: The index that will be written to when any call to write data is made to this stream.

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.BitPosition
member.summary: Bit offset into the buffer that new data will be written to.

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.BitLength
member.summary: Length of data (in bits) that is considered to be written to the stream.

member.name: P:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.BitAligned
member.summary: Whether or not the current BitPosition is evenly divisible by 8. I.e. whether or not the BitPosition is at a byte boundary.

member.name: M:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.Flush
member.summary: Flush stream. This does nothing since data is written directly to a byte buffer.

member.name: M:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.Grow(System.Int64)
member.summary: Grow buffer if possible. According to Max(bufferLength, 1) * growthFactor^Ceil(newContent/Max(bufferLength, 1))
member.param: How many new values need to be accomodated (at least).

member.name: M:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.ReadByteMisaligned
member.summary: Read a misaligned byte. WARNING: If the current BitPosition isn't byte misaligned, avoid using this method as it may cause an IndexOutOfBoundsException in such a case.
member.returns: A byte extracted from up to two separate buffer indices.

member.name: M:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.ReadByteAligned
member.summary: Read an aligned byte from the buffer. It's recommended to not use this when the BitPosition is byte-misaligned.
member.returns: The byte stored at the current Position index

member.name: M:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream._ReadByte
member.summary: Read a byte as a byte. This is just for internal use so as to minimize casts (cuz they ugly af).

member.name: M:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Read a byte from the buffer. This takes into account possible byte misalignment.
member.returns: A byte from the buffer or, if a byte can't be read, -1.

member.name: M:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.PeekByte
member.summary: Peeks a byte without advancing the position
member.returns: The peeked byte

member.name: M:MLAPI.Serialization.BitStream.ReadBit
member.summary: Read a single bit from the stream.
member.returns: A bit in bool format. (True represents 1, False represents 0)

Offset into the buffer to write data to.
How many bytes to attempt to read.
member.returns: Amount of bytes read.

member.summary: Set position in stream to read from/write to.

member.name: T:MLAPI.Serialization.UIntFloat
member.summary: A struct with a explicit memory layout. The struct has 4 fields. float,uint,double and ulong. Every field has the same starting point in memory. If you insert a float value, it can be extracted as a uint. This is to allow for lockless and garbage free conversion from float to uint and double to ulong. This allows for VarInt encoding and other integer encodings.

member.name: T:MLAPI.Transports.Multiplex.MultiplexTransportAdapter
member.summary: Multiplex transport adapter.

member.name: T:MLAPI.Transports.Multiplex.MultiplexTransportAdapter.ConnectionIdSpreadMethod
member.summary: The method to use to distribute the transport connectionIds in a fixed size 64 bit integer.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Transports.Multiplex.MultiplexTransportAdapter.ConnectionIdSpreadMethod.MakeRoomLastBits
member.summary: Drops the first few bits (left side) by shifting the transport clientId to the left and inserting the transportId in the first bits. Ensure that ALL transports dont use the last bits in their produced clientId. For incremental clientIds, this is the most space efficient assuming that every transport get used an equal amount.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Transports.Multiplex.MultiplexTransportAdapter.ConnectionIdSpreadMethod.ReplaceFirstBits
member.summary: Drops the first few bits (left side) and replaces them with the transport index. Ensure that ALL transports dont use the first few bits in the produced clientId.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Transports.Multiplex.MultiplexTransportAdapter.ConnectionIdSpreadMethod.ReplaceLastBits
member.summary: Drops the last few bits (right side) and replaces them with the transport index. Ensure that ALL transports dont use the last bits in their produced clientId. This option is for advanced users and will not work with the official MLAPI transports as they use the last bits.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Transports.Multiplex.MultiplexTransportAdapter.ConnectionIdSpreadMethod.MakeRoomFirstBits
member.summary: Drops the last few bits (right side) by shifting the transport clientId to the right and inserting the transportId in the first bits. Ensure that ALL transports dont use the first bits in their produced clientId.

member.name: F:MLAPI.Transports.Multiplex.MultiplexTransportAdapter.ConnectionIdSpreadMethod.Spread
member.summary: Spreads the clientIds evenly among the transports.
